attributes.action: Lower the grade boundaries for university students
attributes.additional_details: I honestly don't know a single student at my university not suffering form anxiety and/or depression since returning to uni. Mental health is becoming an ever-growing issue in this day of age. Since COVID-19 hit, the rise in mental health victims is growing by the day. This is having a catastrophic impact on higher education students across the globe, struggling to focus on their work, and unable to complete assignments/ exams to the best of their ability. This will, in turn, put current higher education students at a disadvantage when looking at their futures.
attributes.background: 1. Lower the grade boundaries for all students 2. Provide more support, specifically for students suffering from mental health 3. Simplify assignments/ essays

rejection.details:
Universities are autonomous institutions so setting grade boundaries and assignments are a matter for individual universities, not the Government or House of Commons.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to fund additional mental health support for university students whose courses have been affected by the Covid-19 outbreak.

We understand that the current situation is stressful for many people, including students. Student Minds, a mental health charity for students, is collating guidance and developing resources to support students experiencing stress as a result of the current situation, which you may find useful: https://www.studentminds.org.uk/coronavirus.html
